messages.message: The theory then was that the document was scanned with a machine that had built in OCR
And something crashed and created an off-by-one error with the text layer
Such that each image document received the text layer of some prior document
If you use the process files flag to force it to be treated as an image
You can get Instabase to ignore that text layer
@Kerry don’t have access to the repo.  I can also look into this.
(And I’m on mobile so couldn’t check either, but your description sounds just like that situation above)
But, TBH, I won’t be able to get to it by this week.  Is this urgent?

this is another problematic link. 2 out of 19 pdfs
https://www.instabase.com/apps/ocr/review-doc/kerry/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/DHL/samples/out/s1_process_files/p88.pdf.ibocr?i=0&ibflowresults=

hmm so @Ted when i turn on `force_image_ocr` the previous two links are back to normal _but_ some other document (see link) went wrong…. it seems pretty random…
https://www.instabase.com/apps/ocr/review-doc/kerry/my-repo/fs/Instabase%20Drive/DHL/samples/out/s1_process_files/p01.pdf.ibocr?i=0&ibflowresults=#

@shaunak we have a deadline for the DHL POC that is 1/28, but I don’t think it’s a hard deadline (@Matt?). I think we would want to make sure that this is not a platform bug happening across our clients though
